name: AFGPipelineAttachmentHologram
comment: Base attachment class for buildables built onto pipelines

methods.name: TrySnapToConnection
methods.comment:
@note -	This will return the location of the component, it will not account for Local PipeComponent transform offset.
		Placing the hologram component to component must be done manually per case as the desired behavior can vary.

properties.name: mConnection0
properties.comment: Name of the pass through input connection.

properties.name: mConnection1
properties.comment: Name of the pass through output connection.

properties.name: mMaxValidTurnOffset
properties.comment: Used to limit the placement in turns. What's the maximum offset to check from center to detect the curve.

properties.name: mMaxValidTurnAngle
properties.comment: Used to limit the placement in turns. What's the maximum angle.

properties.name: mRotationAxis
properties.comment: The axis to rotate around for scroll rotation

properties.name: mIncrementSnappedConnectionOnScroll
properties.comment: Should this attachment increment its snapped connection index on Scroll?

properties.name: mUseProducerDirectionalArrow
properties.comment: Whether or not to display directional arrows on producer component types

properties.name: mProducerArrowRelativeLocation
properties.comment: Local location to place the producer directional arrow mesh if enabled

properties.name: mWallSnapOffset
properties.comment: When snapping to a Wall apply this offset on the wall.

properties.name: mProducerComponentArrows
properties.comment: Directional indicator. Added to visualize "Producer" type pipe connection components direction

properties.name: mPipeConnectionComponents
properties.comment: Cached list of all connections in this attachment hologram

properties.name: mSnapConnectionIndex
properties.comment: Index of the connection component we wish to snap

properties.name: mSnappedConnectionComponent
properties.comment:
The pipeline connection Component we have snapped to. Can be NULL
 Used when attempting to place the attachment at the end of a pipe that is not connected

properties.name: mSnappedPipelineOffset
properties.comment: The offset we snapped on the pipeline.
